senses.definition: an agreement or arrangement between people or groups with different opinions that is acceptable to everyone; the process of reaching this agreement

a very small living creature that consists of only one cell

senses.definition: the long thin part of a nerve cell along which signals are sent to other cells

senses.definition: a company, person or form of technology that causes significant change in an industry or market by means of innovation (= new ideas or methods)

senses.definition: to separate into parts; to make something separate into parts

senses.definition: in a way that is connected with genes (= the units in the cells of a living thing that control its physical characteristics) or genetics (= the study of genes )

the science of changing how a living creature or plant develops by changing the information in its genes
the use of genetic engineering to change how a plant or living creature develops

senses.definition: the scientific study of the ways in which different characteristics are passed from each generation of living things to the next
the complete set of genes in a cell or living thing Genome

senses.definition: the combination of genes that a particular living thing carries, some of which may not be noticed from its appearance
a very small living thing that can cause infection and disease

examples.x: Disinfectant kills germs.

senses.definition: an early stage of the development of something

examples.x: Here was the germ of a brilliant idea.

senses.definition: the part of a plant or an animal that can develop into a new one

examples.x: The germ is the embryo of the new plant.

senses.definition: genetically modified (of a plant), having had its genetic structure changed artificially, so that it will, for example, produce more fruit or not be affected by disease

a plant, etc. that has had its genetic structure changed artificially, so that, for example, it will produce more fruit or not be affected by disease (the abbreviation for ‘genetically modified organism’)
a living thing that has two varying forms of a particular gene, and whose young may therefore vary in a particular characteristic
a chemical substance that is given out in the body in response to an injury or an allergy
similar in position, structure, etc. to something else

senses.definition: an animal or plant that has parents of different species or varieties

senses.definition: something that is the product of mixing two or more different things
